definitions: having no value, usefulness, or importance of any kind
completely lacking in practical use or effectiveness
morally contemptible and deserving no respect or consideration
examples: The old coins turned out to be worthless replicas
His worthless advice only made the situation worse
These broken tools are completely worthless to me
The worthless warranty didn't cover any damages
He felt like a worthless person after losing everything
Their worthless behavior disgusted everyone at the meeting

definitions: worth the time, money, or effort spent on something
having sufficient value or benefit to justify doing or pursuing
examples: Learning a new language is a worthwhile investment
The long journey was worthwhile for such views
She found worthwhile work helping disadvantaged children
Their worthwhile contributions improved the community significantly

definitions: deserving respect, admiration, or support due to good qualities
deserving or suitable for a particular thing or action mentioned
having moral worth and deserving praise or approval
examples: She proved herself a worthy successor to the position
His worthy achievements earned him international recognition
The charity is worthy of your generous support
This issue is worthy of serious consideration
Their worthy intentions helped many people in need
He lived a worthy life dedicated to others

definitions: past tense and past participle of the verb wind
examples: The old clock was wound every Sunday morning
She wound the string around her finger carefully

definitions: having suffered a physical injury, especially from violence or accident
emotionally hurt or damaged by someone's words or actions
examples: The wounded soldiers received immediate medical attention
A wounded animal can be extremely dangerous
Her wounded pride prevented her from apologizing
His wounded expression showed how deeply hurt he was

definitions: causing or inflicting physical injury or damage to someone
causing emotional pain or distress through words or actions
examples: The wounding attack left several people hospitalized
They found wounding evidence at the crime scene
His wounding remarks ruined their long friendship
The wounding criticism affected her self-esteem deeply

definitions: made by interlacing threads or strips of material together
skillfully combined or integrated into a complex whole
examples: The woven basket held fresh fruit beautifully
She wore a finely woven silk scarf
Their stories were woven together into one narrative
Complex themes were woven throughout the novel

definitions: covered, enclosed, or bound with paper, cloth, or other material
completely absorbed or engrossed in something or someone
examples: The wrapped presents sat under the Christmas tree
She kept the wrapped sandwiches fresh for lunch
He was completely wrapped up in his work
The children were wrapped up in the story

definitions: severely damaged or destroyed, especially beyond repair or use
extremely tired or exhausted from physical or mental effort
heavily intoxicated by alcohol or drugs
examples: The wrecked car was towed away from the accident
The wrecked building posed a safety hazard
I'm completely wrecked after that marathon workout
She looked wrecked after working three consecutive shifts
He got totally wrecked at the party last night
They were too wrecked to drive home safely

definitions: causing severe emotional pain, distress, or anguish
involving a violent twisting or pulling motion
examples: The wrenching decision to leave tore the family apart
It was a wrenching farewell at the airport
The wrenching force nearly broke his arm
A wrenching pain shot through her shoulder

definitions: in a very unhappy or unfortunate state of misery
of very poor quality or condition; extremely inadequate
morally reprehensible and deserving contempt or pity
examples: The wretched refugees needed immediate humanitarian aid
She felt wretched after hearing the terrible news
They lived in wretched conditions without running water
The wretched weather ruined our vacation plans
His wretched behavior at the funeral shocked everyone
The wretched thief stole from the charity box

definitions: having lines or folds in the skin, especially from age
having creases or rumples in fabric or other material
examples: His wrinkled face showed years of wisdom
Her wrinkled hands told stories of hard work
The wrinkled shirt needed to be ironed
She smoothed out the wrinkled newspaper

definitions: making twisting movements due to pain or strong emotion
moving with a twisting or snake-like motion
examples: The writhing patient needed immediate pain relief
She was writhing in agony from the injury
The writhing snake slithered through the grass
Writhing dancers moved to the hypnotic music

definitions: expressed or recorded in letters or words on paper or screen
composed or created specifically for reading rather than speaking
examples: Please submit a written request for approval
The written agreement supersedes any verbal promises
Her written English is better than her spoken
The written word has tremendous power to influence

definitions: relating to the Lutheran Church or its religious beliefs and practices
examples: The Lutheran minister delivered an inspiring sermon
They attended the Lutheran school downtown

definitions: relating to Macedonia, its people, language, or culture
examples: The Macedonian cuisine features wonderful Mediterranean flavors
She studied Macedonian history at the university

definitions: using clever lies and tricks to achieve political or personal goals
examples: His Machiavellian tactics destroyed his opponents politically
The Machiavellian plot involved multiple layers of deception

definitions: relating to Madagascar, its people, or their language and culture
examples: The Madagascan lemurs are found nowhere else on Earth
They enjoyed traditional Madagascan music and dance

definitions: relating to the Arctic region around the North Pole
extremely cold like the conditions found in Arctic regions
examples: Arctic explorers face extreme weather conditions daily
The Arctic ice is melting due to climate change
The arctic wind made everyone shiver uncontrollably
We experienced arctic temperatures during the winter storm

definitions: relating to Argentina, its people, or their culture
having a silvery appearance or quality like silver
examples: The Argentine tango originated in Buenos Aires
They served traditional Argentine beef at dinner
The argentine scales of the fish gleamed underwater
Her argentine voice rang clearly through the hall

definitions: relating to Argentina, its people, language, or culture
examples: The Argentinian football team won the championship
She learned to cook Argentinian dishes from her grandmother

definitions: relating to Armenia, its people, language, or culture
examples: The Armenian alphabet has thirty-eight unique letters
They visited ancient Armenian churches in Yerevan

definitions: relating to Asia, its peoples, languages, or cultures
examples: Asian cuisine includes diverse flavors from many countries
The Asian market offers fresh produce daily

definitions: relating to Asia or its peoples, now often considered outdated
examples: The Asiatic lion population lives primarily in India
Ancient Asiatic trade routes connected distant civilizations

definitions: relating to the Atlantic Ocean or regions bordering it
examples: Atlantic storms can be particularly severe in winter
The Atlantic coast attracts millions of tourists annually

definitions: relating to ancient Athens or the Athenian dialect
characterized by simple and refined elegance in style
examples: The Attic dialect influenced modern Greek significantly
They studied Attic Greek in classical studies
Her Attic wit delighted everyone at the dinner
The speaker's Attic style impressed the audience

definitions: relating to Australasia, including Australia, New Zealand, and nearby islands
examples: The Australasian wildlife includes many unique species
They attended the Australasian medical conference last year

definitions: relating to Australia, its people, or their culture and language
examples: The Australian outback covers vast areas of land
She loves Australian wine from the Barossa Valley

definitions: relating to Austria, its people, language, or culture
examples: The Austrian Alps offer spectacular skiing opportunities
They enjoyed traditional Austrian pastries in Vienna

definitions: relating to Azerbaijan, its people, language, or culture
examples: The Azerbaijani carpet weaving tradition dates back centuries
She studied Azerbaijani literature at the university

definitions: not fair, just, or legal; involving injustice or illegality
examples: He filed a wrongful termination lawsuit against the company
The wrongful conviction was overturned after new evidence emerged

definitions: shaped or formed with care, especially by hammering metal
brought about or caused, especially changes or damage
examples: The wrought iron gates were beautifully crafted
They admired the finely wrought silver jewelry
The storm wrought terrible destruction on the coast
Time has wrought many changes in the city

definitions: showing dry, mocking humor often with a twist of irony
twisted or bent to one side in an expression
examples: His wry sense of humor lightened tense situations
She made a wry comment about the situation
A wry smile crossed his face at the news
She gave a wry grimace at the suggestion

definitions: having or showing intense fear or dislike of people from other countries
examples: His xenophobic attitudes prevented him from traveling abroad
The xenophobic policies damaged international relations significantly

definitions: the Roman numeral representing the number twelve
examples: Chapter XII discusses the main character's transformation
King Louis XII ruled France in the Renaissance

definitions: the Roman numeral representing the number thirteen
examples: Article XIII addresses constitutional amendments in detail
The XIII amendment abolished slavery in America

definitions: the Roman numeral representing the number fourteen
examples: Louis XIV was known as the Sun King
Section XIV outlines the regulatory compliance requirements

definitions: the Roman numeral representing the number nineteen
examples: The XIX century saw tremendous industrial advancement
Amendment XIX gave women the right to vote

definitions: the Roman numeral representing the number forty-one
examples: Super Bowl XLI was played in Miami Gardens
Chapter XLI reveals the story's surprising conclusion

definitions: the Roman numeral representing the number forty-two
examples: Super Bowl XLII featured an historic upset victory
Article XLII defines the emergency powers provision

definitions: the Roman numeral representing the number forty-three
examples: Super Bowl XLIII was won by the Pittsburgh Steelers
Section XLIII covers international trade agreements

definitions: the Roman numeral representing the number forty-four
examples: Super Bowl XLIV took place in Miami, Florida
Chapter XLIV describes the protagonist's final journey

definitions: the Roman numeral representing the number forty-five
examples: Super Bowl XLV was played at Cowboys Stadium
Article XLV addresses international humanitarian law

definitions: the Roman numeral representing the number forty-six
examples: Super Bowl XLVI featured a rematch of teams
Section XLVI outlines dispute resolution procedures

definitions: the Roman numeral representing the number forty-seven
examples: Super Bowl XLVII experienced an unexpected power outage
Chapter XLVII brings closure to the subplot

definitions: the Roman numeral representing the number forty-eight
examples: Super Bowl XLVIII was held at MetLife Stadium
Article XLVIII establishes the arbitration framework

definitions: the Roman numeral representing the number sixteen
examples: Pope Benedict XVI served from 2005 to 2013
Chapter XVI introduces the story's main antagonist

definitions: the Roman numeral representing the number seventeen
examples: The XVII century marked significant scientific discoveries
Article XVII defines property rights and ownership

definitions: the Roman numeral representing the number eighteen
examples: The XVIII century brought the Age of Enlightenment
Amendment XVIII established prohibition in the United States

definitions: the Roman numeral representing the number twenty-one
examples: The XXI century began with significant technological advances
Chapter XXI reveals the mystery's surprising solution
